intro: Colladonia anatolica, commonly known as the Anatolian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Turkey. It features showy blue to violet flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or open habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
